name: Fitz
descriptions: Fitz is the co-owner of the Grub n' Gulp Rest Stop with Lupe in 2281.
Fitz sells food to any travelers that decide to stop by. He sells a small number of various foods such as radroach meat and iguana bits.

Not Worth a Hill of Corn and Beans: Fitz is one of the three meat suppliers for Camp McCarran on Farber's list. He can be convinced to trade with McCarran either by being told he'll be paid in caps, or by being persuaded to trade in exchange for vegetables via a Speech 60 check or a Barter 60 check. Either skill check results in a larger reward than the former option.

topics.response_text: Welcome to the Grub n' Gulp!

topics.topic_text: Show me what you have for sale.
May I ask you some questions?
Where can I find a doctor around here?
topics.response_text: Doctor Usanagi runs a medical clinic up the road.

topics.topic_text: Is there any place to buy weapons and armor?
topics.response_text: I think there a few places, but I've heard that the Gun Runners sell the best.

topics.topic_text: I don't have any more questions. Let's talk about something else.
McCarran is looking for a regular delivery of meat from local merchants.
topics.response_text: Really?  Well, I obviously couldn't supply enough to feed the entire camp, but I'm game.  What kind of caps are we talking here?

topics.topic_text: Corporal Farber said they can pay you the going market price in caps.
topics.response_text: Hey, that sounds good to me.  No more wasted meat just laying around to rot.  I can keep my stock fresh and keep the caps flowing.

topics.topic_text: They have an tons of vegetables and water.  How about expanding your business?
topics.response_text: Expanding isn't a bad idea.  Maybe I could open up a small cafe restaurant with the more diverse inventory...

topics.topic_text: McCarran could work out a regular exchange of fresh vegetables and clean water.
topics.response_text: Rations do get tight from time-to-time and it would be nice to keep a regular stock of goods.

topics.topic_text: Show me what you have for sale.

topics.response_text: I do decent enough. The NCR patrols usually stop by for a quick bite, and travelers like yourself pass by a couple times a week.
Just a little rest stop that me and my good friend Lupe set up. Last stop on your way into New Vegas, first stop on your way out, that's what I say.
